modName: BethINI - Bethesda .ini Files Manager - TES5 Tutorial
summary:
An ever evolving, step-by-step, guide in GP fashion for BethINI.
From installation to setup. Every setting covered for every game and a navigable video to visually compare them all.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3][center]These guides are the foundation of all tutorials on [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF1Qkw7OUG4JmIrw1QI-oWg]GamerPoets[/url]. Come say hi.[/center][/size]
A quote from BethINI's creator,

"BethINI (pronounced "Bethany") is an attempt to restore decency to the INI configuration files for games created by Bethesda, while optimizing your game settings for optimal graphical fidelity and performance. It currently supports Oblivion, Skyrim, Skyrim Special Edition, Fallout 3 Fallout New Vegas, and Fallout 4. It arose out of my research into the Skyrim INI files over on [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Main_Page]STEP[/url]." -DoubleYou / Vuud


[size=3][b]Summary of Contents[/b][/size]
[list]
[*][size=2]Correct Installation[/size]
[*][size=2]Issue prevention & Troubleshooting[/size]
[*][size=2]Each Skyrim setting [/size]
[/list]-what each setting does
-what .ini file settings they correspond with
-video examples of each

-insert and center video-


[center][b][size=3]Back In Touch With The Community[/size][/b]

If there is additional information that you feel is worth adding leave a comment. If you find error's in this guide mention them. If your fixes or suggestions are implemented you will be credited. Maintaining so many guides at once keeps my response rate slow but I AM paying attention. I respond faster to comments on the videos themselves as it's easier for me to manage. As the text becomes updated so will the video (if the text updates warrant one for the video). While pieces of my guides seem trivial and needless to some I assure you that is not the case. I base them on thousands of comments, emails and PM's that I have read over the years to accommodate as many as possible. I don't have all of the answers but I do listen. I look forward to hearing from you. 


*****A text .doc of this tutorial can be found in the Files tab. If you have found this guide helpful consider downloading it and leaving an endorsement. As more Skyrim Tutorials are created I will link them at the bottom of this page.***** [/center]

[/spoiler]Selecting a section title will open the specific section of the BethINI video related to it. This is done so you can easily find and or compare each setting if desired. 


1.0.0[size=5] [b]PreInstallation[/b]
[/size]
Here we will prepare for a smooth installation process. If you need some troubleshooting help this section is it. 


1.1.0[size=3] [b]Introducing BethINI[/b]

[/size]View the official BethINI nexus page [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/4875/?]here[/url]. Read everything. Tell Vuud that we sent you. He deserves every endorsement he gets. 


1.2.0 [size=3][b]Establish .ini Files[/b]
[/size]
If you have never launched the game, do so. This will establish your .ini Files so that BethINI can wake from her beauty sleep. If you have not (properly) setup the base game view our Installation & Setup guide (videos evolve overtime with your help and links will be swapped out).

[list]
[*][size=2]Text Guide [/size]
[*][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=akfICm8eCWs][size=2]Video Guide[/size][/url]
[/list]
A proper installation is the foundation of your entire modding experience. Don't assume that downloading the game and quickly clicking through the options is all that you need to do. Not only do you need to establish your .ini files but the games [b]Launcher Options[/b] offer settings that BethINI does not (at least not yet). It may be beneficial to follow our Installation & Setup guides and then use this BethINI guide afterwards to assure that you gain the best of both.

Once you have established your .ini files, even if you have already tweaked them, do not delete the files themselves. I repeat, “Do NOT delete them”. BethINI needs them to keep her company. She’s a lonely girl. 


1.3.0 [size=3][b]Prior .ini Tweaks[/b][/size]

Many modders will have already tweaked their .ini's. You don’t need to reset your .ini files or to start a new game but consider what tweaks you have made. If you have raised the uGridstoLoad setting you should know that lowering it is going to cause CTD’s on your current save file. If you have followed untested guides around the internet, removing what they have told you to implement even if their instructions were harmful, may cause oddities and crashes. Again, while not explicitly necessary, I would recommend starting a new game to assure a smooth setup and game progression. If your save file already has issues this will not fix them. 

ENB users will want to assure that BethINI hasn’t accidentally disabled necessary .ini tweaks after saving a session. At this time only Skyrim has a specific checkbox to assure that all ENB settings are safely preserved. SE may receive this feature in the future.


1.4.0[size=3] [b]Monitor Resolution[/b][/size]

Without a correct monitor resolution setting you may receive the error  “Failed to Initialize Renderer” when launching BethINI in the next section. Most times monitor resolution is automatically detected but not always.

[list]
[*][size=2]Navigate to the game launcher: [b]Steam[/b]\[b]SteamApps[/b]\[b]Common[/b]\[b]Skyrim [/b][/size]
[*][size=2]Double-click the game [b]Launcher.exe[/b] (no .exe? View [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3WtMgSIbyyU]THIS[/url] ). Select [b]OPTIONS[/b] on the main menu.[/size]
[*][size=2]Within [b]Resolutions[/b] select the option that represents your monitor. If you have a 24K diamond plated monitor choose the highest resolution available.[/size]
[*][size=2]Select [b]OK[/b]. [b]Exit[/b] the menu.[/size]
[/list]

1.5.0[size=3] [b]Antivirus Issues[/b][/size]

The issues below tend to arise due to an overly sensitive AV. Each antivirus requires slightly different steps to perform the same operations. Refer to your AV manual or use google to search for and apply what is mentioned.

1.5.1 [b]BethINI Won’t Load
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]The cursor spins? The program doesn’t load? The process is not created? Add BethINI.exe to your antivirus exclusion list.[/size]
[/list]
1.5.2 [b]BethINI is a Virus!
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]No she’s not and calling her one hurts her feelings. It’s a false positive. See the VirusTotal report or give your trust to some of the top mod and application authors in the community.  White-list BethINI by adding her to your exclusion list.[/size]
[/list]

1.6.0 [size=3][b]Mod Organizer Users[/b][/size]

M.O. users generally have a different installation process when using third party programs due to it’s self containment. That is not true with BethINI. She will not be contained. Follow along with this guide just like everyone else. In preparation:

[list]
[*][size=2]Close M.O. before launching BethINI (right now)[/size]
[*][size=2]Do [b]NOT [/b]install BethINI to Mod Organizer itself[/size]
[*][size=2]Know in advance what [b]Profile[/b] you will be using BethINI with[/size]
[*][size=2]Pay attention to the [b]Setup Tab[/b] instructions within the [b]Launcher Settings[/b] section[/size]
[/list]

2.0.0 [b][size=5]Installation[/size][/b]

Here we will cover where and how to download BethINI and how to configure the executable to prevent some potential security issues.


2.1.0 [b][size=3]Downloading & Installing BethINI[/size][/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Download the most recent (and tested) [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/4875/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrimspecialedition%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D4875&pUp=1]MAIN FILES[/url] version of BethINI. [/size]
[*][size=2]Extract the archives contents to their own folder (no archival program? View [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H3-6JyyAh0]THIS[/url]). [/size]
[*][size=2]You can technically install/extract BethINI anywhere. However, I like to be organized and keep all of my modding applications together. I’m going to navigate to: [b]Steam[/b]\S[b]teamApps[/b]\[b]Common[/b]\[b]Skyrim [/b][/size]
[*][size=2]In the games folder [b]Create[/b] a [b]New Folder[/b]. Name the folder[b] BethINI[/b]. [/size]
[*][size=2]Drag all of BethINI's files inside. If you lose her things she will never forgive you. [/size]
[/list]

2.2.0 [b][size=3]Issue Prevention[/size][/b]

Some have reported that BethINI only works when [b]Run... as an administrator[/b]. Let’s be proactive. 

[list]
[*][size=2]Right-click the [b]BethINI.exe[/b] (can't see .exe? View [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3WtMgSIbyyU]THIS[/url]).  [/size]
[*][size=2]Open [b]Properties[/b]. At the bottom of the [b]General Tab [/b]if you see a security message, you may not, with an option to [b]Unblock[/b] the app activate the checkbox to do so. Select [b]Apply[/b]. [/size]
[*][size=2]Open the [b]Compatibility Tab.[/b] Within [b]Settings[/b] activate the check-box next to [b]Run this program as an administrator.[/b] Select [b]Apply[/b]. Select [b]OK[/b]. [/size]
[*][size=2]Double-click the [b]BethINI.exe[/b] . If a [b]User Account Control[/b] window opens select [b]Yes[/b]. When the small [b]Choose Game[/b] window opens expand the drop-down. Select [b]Skyrim[/b] and allow her to initialize. [/size]
[*][size=2]If you have not yet established the default .ini files you will receive an error message. Close [b]BethINI[/b]. Launch game. Close game. Open [b]BethINI[/b]. [/size]
[*][size=2]If the Choose Game window still doesn’t open it is most likely due to your Antivirus blocking the program via a false positive. View your Antivirus manual to see how to white-list [b]BethINI[/b]. [/size]
[/list]

2.3.0 [b][size=3]Shortcut[/size][/b]

To easily access this lovely lady create a shortcut and place it on your desktop. 


3.0.0 [b][size=5]Launcher Settings[/size][/b]

Here we will cover each and every setting within the BethINI interface. All settings have their corresponding .ini File setting(s) listed beneath them for your reference via a "Spoiler". 


[size=3]3.1.0 [b]Miscellaneous Features[/b][/size]

Interface features that don't have select-able options. 


3.1.1 [b]Mod-Auto Detect[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]If you have a mod installed that requires an .ini tweak as suggested by its author, BethINI will automatically detect it and make the changes. It may still good to double check the .ini files after saving the current session in case some mods have yet to be added to BethINI’s [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/articles/134/?]list[/url]. [/size]
[/list]

3.1.2 [b]Setting Messages[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]At the bottom of the interface, after every change that you make, a conformation and or warning message will appear to inform you of what has been done and or what you should be aware of due to your selection.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.0 [b][size=3]Setup Tab[/size][/b]

The Setup Tab will look the same regardless what game you are using BethINI for.  The difference is the information that needs to be applied. 


3.2.1 [b]Game
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]Allows you to select the game that you want to use BethINI with.[/size]
[*][size=2]When changing BethINI to [b]Skyrim[/b] from another game a window will open informing you that Your INI Files were successfully reverted. This means that any changes made in the current session will not be saved. This is done as a precaution. If you want to change games do so when first opening the application.[/size]
[*][size=2]BethINI will then restart and be ready for use with SE.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.2 [b]Game Path[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Needs to point to the game Launcher[/size]
[*][size=2]The Launcher should be automatically detected[/size]
[*][size=2]If for any reason you need to manually choose the launcher: expand the drop-down menu. Select [b]Browse…[/b] . Navigate to [b]Steam[/b]\[b]SteamApps[/b]\[b]Common[/b]\[b]Skyrim [/b].  Select the [b]SkyrimLauncher.exe[/b] .[/size]
[/list]
[b]
3.2.3 Mod Organizer
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]is used to change the Mod Organizer path if needed.[/size]
[*][size=2]Expand the drop-down. Select a [b]Profile[/b] that you wish to use BethINI with. BethINI should automatically detect your profiles (freakin’ magic). [/size]
[*][size=2]If for any reason you need to manually select your [b]Profile[/b]: select [b]Browse… [/b]. Navigate to the folder that you installed Mod Organizer to. [/size]
[*][size=2]If following our tutorials navigate to: <[b]Game Drive[/b]>[b]:[/b]\S[b]team[/b]\[b]SteamApps[/b]\[b]Common[/b]\[b]Skyrim[/b]\[b]Mod Organizer. [/b]Select [b]Open[/b]. BethINI will restart.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.4 [b]INI Path
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]Needs to point to the folder that contains the game's .ini files.[/size]
[/list]
[b]3.2.4.1 Non-Mod Organizer Users[/b] 

[list]
[*][size=2]The .ini file location should be automatically detected. [/size]
[*][size=2]If for any reason you need to manually choose it: expand the drop-down menu. Select [b]Browse… [/b]. Navigate to <[b]OS[/b]>[b]:[/b]\[b]Users[/b]\<[b]User Account[/b]>\[b]Documents[/b]\[b]My Games[/b]\[b]Skyrim[/b] . Select [b]Open[/b]. BethINI should then restart.[/size]
[/list]
3.2.4.2 [b]Mod Organizer Users[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Expand the drop-down. Select a [b]Profile[/b] that you wish to use BethINI with. Yes, BethINI should automatically detect your profiles. [/size]
[*][size=2]If for any reason you need to manually select your [b]Profile[/b]: select [b]Browse… [/b]. Navigate to where you installed Mod Organizer. [/size]
[*][size=2]If following our tutorials navigate to: <[b]Game Drive[/b]>[b]:[/b]\S[b]team[/b]\[b]SteamApps[/b]\[b]Common[/b]\[b]Skyrim[/b]\[b]Mod Organizer[/b][/size]
[*][size=2]Got to: [b]Profiles[/b]\<[b]Profile Name[/b]> . Select [b]Open[/b]. BethINI will restart.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.5 [b]Restore Backup
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]Allows you to revert to any and every .ini File tweaking session that you have had since installing BethINI.[/size]
[*][size=2]Allows you to revert to the .ini Files that existed just before installing BethINI as a backup was made of after the first session. Such a sweet girl.[/size]
[*][size=2]If you want to see the physical backups navigate back to [b]My Games.[/b] Open the [b]Skyrim[/b] folder. Open [b]BethINI Cache[/b]. Each folder within contains the backups of each BethINI session. Drag, Drop and overwrite to manually replace them.[/size]
[*][size=2]The folders are read like so: [b]Year[/b]\[b]Month[/b]\[b]Date[/b]\[b]Hour[/b]\[b]Minute[/b]\[b]Second[/b][/size]
[*][size=2]Once you choose a backup from the drop-down menu the .ini files will be replaced and BethINI will close.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.6 [b]Automatically Check for Updates
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]With this option activated BethINI will check for application updates the moment she opens. If there is an update a button will appear. Click it and you will be brought to the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/4875/?]official[/url] page so that you can update the application.[/size]
[*][size=2]Deactivate this checkbox if you don’t want the feature.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.7 [b]Always Select Game[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]if enabled, BethINI will always ask you what game you would like to use her for at startup.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.8 [b]Make INIs Read-Only
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]When activated you can still make changes via BethINI but you won’t be able to make manual changes to the .ini Files themselves. To do so you can deactivate the option from here or on the .ini Files themselves. [/size]
[*][size=2]To manually undo this during manual tweaking simply right-click each .ini File. Select [b]Properties[/b]. Deactivate the [b]Read-only[/b] checkbox. Select [b]Apply[/b]. Select [b]OK[/b].[/size]
[/list]

3.2.9 Fix Creation Kit

[list]
[*]toggles the ability of BethINI to fix and sort the Creation Kit .ini Files. Enables multiple masters and DLC. 
[/list]
3.2.10 [b]Donate to STEP
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]The Donate to STEP  link will open the direct donation option for the STEP wiki. There are a lot of folks doing a lot of things for the community and all of the money goes towards website costs.[/size]
[/list]

3.2.11 [b]Need Help?
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]This [url=http://forum.step-project.com/topic/8987-bethini-by-doubleyou/]link [/url]will bring you to the official BethINI forum where you can ask for help from her creator. I’m sure that you can find many posts of mine in there.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.0 [b][size=3]Basic Tab[/size][/b]

3.3.0.1 ENB Mode

[list]
[*]if using an ENB activate the checkbox. This option ensures that all settings required for ENB to work will be maintained.
[/list]

3.3.0.2 [b]Enable File Selection[/b]

[list]
[*]toggles the ability of the game launcher to support mod plugins. Activate the checkbox.
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Launcher]
bEnableFileSelection[/b][/spoiler]3.3.0.3 [b]Save and Exit[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Selecting Save and Exit will assure that all changes made within the current session will be applied and saved.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.0.4 [b]Cancel[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Selecting Cancel will assure that none of the changes that you have made within the current session will be applied or saved.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.1 [size=3][b]Basic Display[/b][/size]

3.3.1.1 [b]Display Adapter[/b]

[list]
[*]changes the monitor, if you have more than one, that the game will be displayed on. If you have only one monitor ignore this setting.
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Dsiplay]
iAdapter[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.2 [b]Resolution[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Set to the highest resolution that your monitor can handle.  Lower the resolution to trade quality for better performance.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
iSize H
iSize W[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.3 [b]Antialiasing
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]directly related to the jagged and crawling lines at the edges of objects. Select,[b] 4 Samples[/b]. The subtle difference between 4 and 8 is not worth the performance impact. [/size]
[*][size=2]If using an ENB graphical preset set to [b]None[/b].[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
iMultiSample[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.4 [b]Anisotropic Filtering[/b]

[list]
[*]directly affects texture clarity displayed at an angle on screen. Select 16x. 8x will provide the slightest of performance gains for a noticeable drop in quality. 
[*]If using an ENB graphical preset set to [b]None[/b].  
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
iMaxAnisotropy[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.5 [b]Windowed Mode[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]If activated, SE will run in a window on the Desktop. This allows you to maintain a sharp in-game image while running the game lower than your monitor’s native resolution.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
bFull Screen[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.6 [b]FXAA[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]activates Fast Approximate Anti Aliasing. Essentially an Antialiasing hack that can be used inplace of AA for lower end systems or along side AA for higher end system. FXAA will subtly blur the game. Countered well with Sweet FX. [/size]
[*][size=2]I have FXAA acitvated. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkrimPrefs.ini
[b][Diplay]
bFXAAEnabled[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.7 [b]Always Active[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2][b]Alt-Tabbing[/b] to the Desktop or [b]clicking[/b] outside of a windowed game will cause it to pause. This option allows the game to keep running in those circumstances. I have this[b] deactivated[/b].[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
bAlwaysActive[/b][/spoiler]3.3.1.8 [b]VSync[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]When activated, will cap your maximum FPS to your monitor’s refresh rate. This helps to avoid screen tearing. I have[b] activated[/b] .[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][size=2][Display][/size]
iPresentInterval[/b][/spoiler]3.3.2 [size=3][b]Basic Presets

[/b][/size]3.3.2.1 [b]Vanilla Presets[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]When activated the Preset buttons will mirror the vanilla game launcher presets.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.2 [b]BethINI Presets
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]When activated the Preset buttons will be enhanced for both performance and visual quality. BethINI Presets are much more refined and they have been thoroughly tested. I have this option activated.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.3 [b]Recommended Tweaks[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Will work with or without a Preset option. When activated a select set of SE tweaks will be implemented to enhance both performance and quality. View the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/articles/134/?]Recommended Tweaks list[/url] to see the current tweaks for this option.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.4 [b]Poor [/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]is suggested to be used if you have a really slow computer and struggle to get 20fps on Low. The vanilla game doesn’t offer this option.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.5 [b]Low[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]is suggested to be used if you have a slow computer and struggle to get 24fps on medium. As mentioned, this BethINI Preset will offer better performance and clarity than the[b] Vanilla Low[/b] Preset.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.6 [b]Medium[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]is suggested to be used if you have an average computer and struggle to get 24fps on high or for those who only manage 40fps in High and want more frames per second. As mentioned, this BethINI Preset will offer better performance and clarity than the Vanilla Medium Preset.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.7 [b]High [/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]is suggested to be used if you have a fast computer but experience sudden frame-drops on Ultra. As mentioned, this BethINI Preset will offer better performance and clarity than the Vanilla high Preset.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.8[b] Ultra[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]is suggested to be used only if you have a very fast computer. However, some may experience sudden frame-drops due to rendering most of the game settings at their  maximum draw distance. As mentioned, this BethINI Preset will offer better performance and clarity than the Vanilla Ultra Preset.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.2.9[b] Default [/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]will reset the game's .ini files to their vanilla, default values.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.3 [b][size=3]General Tab[/size][/b]

3.3.3.1[b] Intro Logos[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when deactivated the intro Logos and video will no longer appear. This is used to save a few seconds on startup.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
sSequenceIntro[/b][/spoiler]3.3.3.2 [b]Intro Music
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]if deactivated the music that plays at the game's title screen will be muted.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
sMainMenuMusic[/b][/spoiler]3.3.3.3 [b]Disable Screenshots[/b]

[list]
[*]when activated the Print Screen key will no longer be able to take and save screenshots. Perhaps beneficial for those who need to create an additional hotkey.  
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Display]
bAllowScreenShot[/b][/spoiler]3.3.3.4[b] Disable Tutorials

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated the in-game tutorial pop-up windows will be deactivated. [/size]
[/list][/b][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Interface]
bShowTutorials[/b][/spoiler]3.3.3.5 [b]Modder's Paradise Mode[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated, markers for objects and their bounds will be vidible in-game the same way that they are in the Creation Kit.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Display]
bShowMarkers[/b][/spoiler]3.3.4 [b][size=3]General Papyrus[/size][/b]

3.3.4.1 [b]Logging[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when deactivated[b] Papyrus Logs[/b] will not be written to disk. Deactivting this will save a tiny bit of memory. [/size]
[*][size=2]I keep this deactivated[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][Papyrus][/size]
bEnableLogging[/b][/spoiler]3.3.4.2 [b]Debug Info[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles addtional Debug information. If enabled, line number information will be available in error traces at the expense of higher memory usage.[/size]
[*][size=2]I keep this deactivated.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Papyrus]
[size=2]bLoadDebugInformation[/size][/b][/spoiler]3.3.4.3 [b]Profiling[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles scrip profiling, which enables profiling commands and allows profiling information to be logged at the cost of some script performance. [/size]
[*][size=2]I keep this deactivated.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Papyrus]
bEnableProfiling[/b][/spoiler]3.3.4.4 [b]Tracing[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles script tracing.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Papyrus]
bEnableTrace[/b][/spoiler]3.3.4.5 [b]Background Load Scripting VM[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles loading the scripting data in the VM in the background. May improve performance but there is currently no proof of this. [/size]
[*][size=2]SE has this deactivated by default.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
bBackgroundLoadVMData[/b][/spoiler]3.3.4.6[b] Post-Load Update Time[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the time, in milliseconds, given to scripts during loading. Higher values mean longer loading screens but offers the potential for smoother game-play when using a lot of scripted mods. [/size]
[*][size=2]I have this set to[b] 2000[/b].[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][Papyrus][/size]
fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS[/b][/spoiler]3.3.5 [b][size=3]Gameplay Tab[/size][/b]

3.3.5.1 [b]Always Run by Default [/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]if deactivated your character will walk by default instead of always running. [b]Caps Lock [/b]will toggle running back on.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Controls]
bAlwaysRunByDefault[/b][/spoiler]3.3.5.2 [b]Over-Encumbered Reminder[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]if deactivated your character will walk be default instead of always running. [b]Caps Lock[/b] will toggle running back on. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
fEncumberedReminderTimer[/b][/spoiler]3.3.5.3[b] Remove Borders[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated this will disable the invisible borders at the edge of the game map so that you can move beyond them. Those new to SE may want to leave this enabled to avoid getting lost.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][General][/size]
bBorderRegionsEnabled[/b][/spoiler]3.3.6 [b][size=3]Gameplay Combat[/size][/b]

3.3.6.1[b] NPCs Use Ammo[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated, NPCs will no longer have access to unlimited amounts of ammunition. They will be limited to the finite supply that they spawn with or that they find.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Combat]
bForceNPCsUseAmmo[/b][/spoiler]3.3.6.2 [b]1st Person Arrow Tilt-up Angle[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the upward, arrow tilt-angle in first person. Used to tweak where arrows hit.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Combat]
f1PArrowTiltUpAngle[/b][/spoiler]3.3.6.3[b] 3rd Person Arrow Tilt-up Angle[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the upward, arrow tilt-angle in third person. Used to tweak where arrows hit. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Combat]
f3PArrowTiltUpAngle[/b][/spoiler]3.3.6.4 [b]1st Person Bolt Tilt-up Angle[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the upward, bolt tilt-angle in first person. Used to tweak where bolts hit. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Combat]
f1PBoltTiltUpAngle[/b][/spoiler]3.3.6.5 [b]Disable Combat Dialogue[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]disables enemy trash talking and taunting during battle.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Combat]
bDisableCombatDialogue[/b][/spoiler]3.3.7 [b][size=3]Interface Tab[/size][/b]

3.3.7.1 [b]Show Quest Markers[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Toggles the visibility of quest markers on the map and compass.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][GamePlay][/b]
[b]bShowQuestMarkers[/b][/spoiler]3.3.7.2 [b]Show Compass
[/b]

[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Interface]
bShowCompass[/b][/spoiler]3.3.7.3 [b]Dialogue Subtitles[/b]

[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Interface]
bDialogueSubtitles[/b][/spoiler]3.3.7.4 [b]General Subtitles[/b]

bGeneralSubtitles[/b][/spoiler]3.3.8[size=3] [b]Interface Map Menu[/b][/size]

3.3.8.1 [b]Fix Map Menu Navigation[/b]

[list]

[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][MapMenu]
fMapWorldYawRange
fMapWorldMinPitch
fMapWorldMaxPitch[/b][/spoiler]3.3.8.2 [b]Remove Map Menu Blur[/b]

[list]

[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][MapMenu]
bWorldMapNoSkyDepthBlur
fWorldMapDepthBlurScale
fWorldMapMaximumDepthBlur[/size]
fWorldMapNearDepthBlurScale[/b][/spoiler]3.3.9[b][size=3] Interface Mouse Settings[/size][/b]

3.3.9.1 [b]Background Mouse[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated, the mouse uses the default system speed. Generally too buggy for actual game-play. Suggested to only be used for in-game tweaking for things such as ENB settings. I keep Background Mouse [b]deactivated[/b].[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Controls][/b]
[b]bBackgroundMouse[/b][/spoiler]3.3.9.2[b] Lock Sensitivity[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]determines how quickly the camera will move in response to the mouse. This could be defined as the speed at which your character looks around.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Controls]
fMouseHeadingSensitivity[/b][/spoiler]3.3.9.3 [b]Scale[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the mouse scale value, which determines how far the camera moves when moving the mouse on the X and Y axes.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Controls]
fMouseHeadingXScale
fMouseHeadingYScale[/b][/spoiler]3.3.9.4 [b]Cursor Velocity[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the velocity of the mouse cursor in menus, such as inventory. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Interface]
fMouseCursorSpeed[/b][/spoiler]3.3.9.5[b] Mouse Wheel Zoom Speed[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the transition speed when zooming in and out of third person. Also, effects how fast the transition between first and thrid person is.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][Camera][/size]
fMouseWheelZoomSpeed[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10 [b][size=3]Detail Tab[/size][/b]

3.3.10.1 [b]Texture Quality[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]will adjust the quality of all textures in-game. The lower the setting the more blurry and less detailed textures will appear.[/size]
[/list][size=2][spoiler]Skyrimprefs.ini
[b][Display]
iTexMipMapSkip
iTexMipMapMinimum[/b][/spoiler][/size][size=2]3.3.10.2[b] [/b][b]Field of View[/b][/size]

[list]
[*][size=2]determines your character's field of view. The higher the value the more that you will be able to see on screen in any given situation. As with most numerical settings you can enter values manually if the presets don’t suit your taste.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Display]
fDefaultWorldFOV[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.3[b] [/b][b]Decal Quantity[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]determines the maximum number of decals such as dirt, blood and scorch marks that can be applied in-game at given time.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Decals]
uMaxSkinDecalPerActor[/b]

SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Decals]
uMaxDecals
uMaxSkinDecals[/b]

[b][Display]
iMaxDecalsPerFrame
iMaxSkinDecalsPerFrame[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.4 [b]Particles[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the ammount of particle effects that can be viewed at any given time. [/size]
[*][size=2]I personally set this to[b] 6000[/b].[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Particles]
iMaxDesired[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.5 [b][size=2]Decals[/size]
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]toggles decals on and off.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Decals]
bDecals[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.6 [b]Disable Gore[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated this will remove all blood effects, splatter marks and dismemberment from the game.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
bDisableAllGore[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.7[b] Depth of Field[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]determines whether or not Depth of Field will be used in game. Most noticeable when underwater to reduce visibility. DoF can cause a drop in performance. Unless you absolutely love this feature deactivate it.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Imagespace]
bDoDepthOfField[/b][/spoiler]3.3.10.8[b] Precise Lighting
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]toggles the ability of lighting to be rednering using floating point (decimal) values rather than only integers. When activated lighting will be more precise.[/size]
[/list][size=2][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
bFloatPointRenderTarget[/b][/spoiler][/size]3.3.10.9 [b]Disable Precipitation[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]when activated rain and snow effects will be removed from the game.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][Weather][/size]
bPrecipitation[/b][/spoiler]3.3.11[b][size=3] Detail Water[/size][/b]

[b][Water]
bReflectLODObjects[/b][/spoiler]3.3.11.4[b] Reflect Sky[/b]

[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini

3.3.12.1[b] Remove Shadows[/b]

[list]

[b]fMaxHeightShadowCastingTrees[/b]

[b]bTreesReceiveShadows[/b]

[b][Display]
bDefferedShadows[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.3 [b]Land Shadows[/b]

[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
bDrawLandShadows[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.4 [b]Grass Shadows[/b]

[b][Display]
bShadowsOnGrass[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.5 [b]Tree Shadows[/b]

[list]

[b][Display]
bTreesRecieveShadows[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.6 [b]Shadow Resolution[/b]

[list]

[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
iShadowMapResolution[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.7 [b]Shadow Blurring[/b]

[list]

[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Display]
fShadowDirectionalBiasScale[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.9[b] Exterior Draw Distance[/b]

[b][Display]
fShadowDistance[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.10 [b]Sun-Shadow Update Time

[/list][/b][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Display]
fSunShadowUpdateTime[/b][/spoiler]3.3.12.11 [b]Sun-Shadow Update Threshold[/b]

[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][LOD]
fDistanceMultiplier[/b][/spoiler]3.3.14 [b][size=3]View Distance Distant Object Detail[/size][/b]

3.3.14.1 [b]Preset[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]changes all of the Distant Object Detail settings to predetermined values recommended by BethINI herself.[/size]
[/list]

3.3.14.2[b] Level 4
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]sets the maximum distance for object LOD level 4. LOD, Level of Detail, are the lower resolution, and generally static, objects that you see pop in and become the models that you see up close as you get within a certain distance of them. LOD Level 4 is the closest set of LOD that the player sees. Level 4 is higher resolution than Level 8.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][TerrainManager]
fBlockLevel0Distance[/spoiler][/b]3.3.14.3 [b]Level 8
[/b]
[list]
[*][size=2]sets the maximum distance for object LOD level 8. LOD Level 8 is the mid level LOD of the game. Level 8 is lower resolution than Level 4.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][TerrainManager]
fBlockLevel1Distance[/b][/spoiler]3.3.14.4 [b]Level 16[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]set the maximum distance for object LOD level 16, which beings at the edge of LOD level 8. Level 16 LOD is lower resolution than Level 8.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][size=2][TerrainManager][/size]
fBlockMaximumDistance[/b][/spoiler]3.3.14.5[b] [/b][b]Distance Multiplier[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]sets the distance multiplier for landscape LOD levels.  [/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][TerrainManager]
fSplitDistanceMult[/b][/spoiler]3.3.14.6[b] Decal Fade[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]controls the distance at which decals fade. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][LightingShader]
fDecalLODFadeStart
fDecalLODFadeEnd[/b][/spoiler]3.3.14.7[b] [/b][b]uGridsToLoad[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Sets the amount of active grids to be rendered and processed around the player.  Lowering this value mid-game will corrupt your save. Higher values will initiate in-game sequences earlier than intended. Higher values than 7 have been proven to break the game over time. I have uGridsToLoad set to 7.[/size]
[*][size=2]Unless your PC is high-end and you are an experienced modder leave this set to 5.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][General]
uGridsToLoad[/b][/spoiler]3.3.15 [b][size=3]Foliage Grass[/size][/b]

3.3.15.1[b] Remove Grass[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]When activated will remove all forms of grass from the game.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Grass]
bDrawShaderGrass[/b][/spoiler]3.3.15.2 [b]Grass Wind Speed[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]determines whether or not grass will blow in the wind.[/size]
[/list]
- [b]Default:[/b] will leave Grass Wind Speed  at it’s vanilla settings.

- [b]None:[/b] will stop grass from swaying altogether.
[spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Grass]
fGrassWindMagnitudeMin
fGrassWindMagnitudeMax[/b][/spoiler]3.3.15.3[b] Grass Density[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Determines the overall density of grass. The higher the value the less densely grass will be packed into areas. The lower the value the thicker grassy areas will be.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Grass]
iMinGrassSize[/b][/spoiler]3.3.15.4[b] [/b][b]Grass Diversity[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Determines the maximum diversity of all grass types.  Mods that add additional grass types may inform you to set this to a specific value.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Grass]
iMaxGrassTypesPerTexure[/b][/spoiler]3.3.16 [b][size=3]Foliage Trees[/size][/b]

3.3.16.1 [b]Dynamic Trees[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles between dynamic, activated, and static, deactivated, tree models. Dynamic trees are more detailed and have more character. [/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][size=2][Trees][/size]
bEnableTrees[size=2]
bEnableTreeAnimations[/size][/b][/spoiler]3.3.16.2 [b]Skinned Trees[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles the rendering of enhanced tree detail. If deactivated trees will have a lost less detail and some some performance for lower end systems.  [/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Trees]
bRenderSkinnedTrees[/b][/spoiler]3.3.16.3 [b]Tree Animations[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]toggles the tree animations that simulate them moving in the wind on and off.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]Skyrim.ini
[b][Trees]
fUpdateBudget[/b][/spoiler]3.3.16.4 [b]Tree Detail Fade[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]controls the distance at which tree detail fades. The higher the setting the more performance that will be used but the more likely you are to avoid tree pop-in.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][Display]
fMeshLODLevel1FadeTreeDistance
fMeshLODLevel2FadeTreeDistance
fTreesMidLODSwitchDist
uiMaxSkinnedTreesToRender[/b][/spoiler]3.3.16.5[b] Far-off Tree Distance[/b]

[list]
[*][size=2]Sets the distance at which far-off trees are rendered. This setting will make distant views feel fuller at higher values.[/size]
[/list][spoiler]SkyrimPrefs.ini
[b][TerrainManager]
fTreeLoadDistance[/b][/spoiler]When you have finished making your choices remember to open the[b] Basic tab[/b]. Select[b] Save and Exit[/b] to keep your changes. Select [b]Cancel[/b] to discard them.
